requirement: Requirement 2 - Apply Secure Configurations to All System Components

sections.title: Introduction
sections.content: Requirement 2 ensures that all system components are securely configured to prevent exploitation of default settings. PCI DSS v4.0 expands the need for secure cloud, container, and serverless environments.

sections.title: Requirement 2 at a Glance
sections.content:
- Change default passwords.
- Harden configurations using industry standards.
- Maintain documented baselines.
- Extend to cloud and mobile environments.

sections.title: What This Means in Practice
sections.content: Organizations should use hardened images, change all vendor defaults, and continuously validate configurations. Maturity means automating hardening checks and scanning new assets at onboarding.

sections.title: Gotchas
sections.content:
- Default accounts disabled but not removed.
- Missing hardening for cloud and serverless services.
- No documentation of security configurations.

sections.title: Trusted Advisor (TA) Tip
sections.content: Automate baseline configuration scans and integrate secure config validation into CI/CD pipelines.

content.Executive Lens: Reduces breach risk by eliminating simple entry points.
content.Security & Infra Teams Lens: Focuses on standardizing and validating secure builds.
content.QSA/Consultant Lens: Look for documented baselines and hardened images.
content.Small Business Lens: Use vendor-hardened templates and change defaults during setup.

sections.title: Call to Action (CTA)
sections.content: Assess your environment today: verify that all deployed systems follow a secure baseline.
